page.title: 04LAYER MARNEY NURSERIES
page.content: Mr and Mrs G Trim. The nursery covers five and a half acres. One acre is greenhouses. It is mostly wholesale. They grow tomatoes, bedding plants, geraniums, primroses and chrysanthemums. Tomatoes, bedding plants, and cut flowers are sold locally or taken to Covent Garden. They employ one full time worker and eight part time ladies, usually in spring. This is the machinery they have: one small tractor with accessories, a dump truck, a lorry, rotovators, and tomato grader. Very small tomatoes are called "chits", and are not to be sold. Heating used to be run by coal, but 15 years ago they changed to oil. It costs Â£1200 a year to heat the greenhouses and it is a big worry for the Trims. Fewer greenhouses will be heated this year. They like their job.
